entry.title: 173rd Fighter Wing holding Memorial Day flyovers for Southern Oregon
entry.summary: F-15 jets from the 173rd Fighter Wing will perform Memorial Day flyovers across southern Oregon on Monday, May 26, to honor fallen service members. Locations include Klamath Falls, Roseburg, Reedsport, Gold Beach, Brookings, Grants Pass, and Eagle Point.

entry.title: Providers, community members explore cutting edge scanner at Mercy Outpatient Imaging
entry.summary: For Douglas County residents, the key to an accurate diagnosis might just be in a mobile trailer.

entry.title: DFPA Responds to 45-Acre Doe Hollow Fire Near Days Creek
entry.summary: Fire crews responded to the 45-acre Doe Hollow Fire near Days Creek on May 22. DFPA engines, a dozer, and contract crews are working the scene. The cause remains under investigation. Official mapping and full containment efforts are ongoing.

entry.title: GOVERNOR KOTEK ORDERS FLAGS LOWERED FOR MEMORIAL DAY
entry.summary: May 23, 2025 4:20 p.m. On Friday, Governor Tina Kotek ordered all flags at Oregon public institutions to be flown at half-staff, on Memorial Day from sunrise until noon the same day. Kotek said, “On Memorial Day, we honor our fallen service members with deep gratitude”. Kotek said, “The First Lady and I keep them...

entry.title: Measles vaccination rates are decreasing for Oregons schoolchildren. How does Douglas County stack up?
entry.summary: There’s no debating it: Measles is making a comeback in the U.S. Once declared eradicated, cases of the highly contagious virus have been popping up throughout the country.

entry.title: RHS students graduating with industry certifications, ready to join workforce
entry.summary: More than two dozen Roseburg High School students were recognized this week for completing the training and coursework required to earn professional certifications in health care and emergency services — credentials that will help launch their future careers.

entry.title: Exploring untapped potential for maple syrup production in Douglas County
entry.summary: Western Oregon forests are bursting with opportunity. No matter your interest, there is something for everyone. They provide beautiful places for recreation, excellent habitat for fish and wildlife, clean water for communities, and the opportunity to sustainably harvest wood and…

entry.title: Douglas County employers drop 110 jobs in April
entry.summary: Douglas County’s seasonally adjusted payroll employment decreased by 110 jobs in April after a gain of 100 in March and no change in February.
